Weak perfect compactness and generalized adjoints ’
By D.  R.  Arterburn at New Mexico ( N.  M. ) and Montana ( Mont. )
The purpose of this paper is to answer some of the questions posed in [ 5 ] and to extend the concept of perfect compactness.  If X is a normed linear space and У is a topological linear space,  an operator T \ Z -> У is perfectly { fully ) compact iff the reduced operator T ^: X- ^ R { T ) defined by Tq { x ) = a ; ( rc € Z ) is compact ( respectively,  iff T { S ) is compact,  where S is the closed unit sphere of Z. ) A Danach space Z is perfect iff У a Danach space and T : X- > Y compact imply T perfectly compact.  A 5-space Z is imper fect iff given an infinite-dimensional 5-space У there is an imperfectly compact T : Z -> У.  A 5-space Z is mixed iff Z is neither perfect nor imperfect.  It is not yet known whether any mixed spaces exist. 
1.  It is questioned in [ 5 ] whether or not the topological direct sum of two perfect spaces is perfect.  The following theorem answers this question in the affirmative. 
1.  1 Theorem.  The direct sum of two perfect spaces is perfect.  The direct sum of a perfect space and a mixed space is mixed. 
Proof.  Let Z = Zi 0 Z 2.  Let У be a 5-space with every compact Tii Zi- > У and T ^: Zg -> У perfectly compact.  Let T : Z -> У be compact,  and let Pi and P ^ be the projection of Z onto Zj and Z 2 respectively.  Let Ti be the reduction of У | Zi to 5 ( Г ), T ^ the reduction of T \ X ^ io R { T ). Then Ti and T ^ are compact since 5 ( ri ) 5 ( У | Zj )
and R { T ^ z :> R ( T 1 X 2 ), so TiPi and T 2 P 2 are compact,  whence
T,  = T, { Pi + P 2 ) = T,  Pi + T 0 P 2 = TiPi + T 2 P 2
is compact.  Thus T is perfectly compact. 
Now if T : X 2 ~> Z is imperfectly compact,  TPg * Z- > Z is imperfectly compact.  The theorem follows. 
2.  If Z is a normed linear space and У induces a topology on Z in some fashion,  ( Z,  ТУ ) will denote the topological space Z with the induced topology.  For example,  ( Z,  TZ ') will denote Z with the usual weak topology. 
If Z and У are normed linear spaces and T : Z- > У,  T will be called perfectly weakly compact iff Tq { S ) is weakly conditionally compact ; T will be called fully weakly
*) This paper constitutes part of the author ’ s dissertation,  submitted to the Graduate School of New Mexico State University in partiid fulfillment of the requirements for the Ph.  D.  in Mathematics written while the author was an N.  S.  F.  Coop.  Graduate Fellow,  with partial support from NSF-G26068 and AF-AFOSR 467—63.
